items.title: Armor for Man and Horse with Völs-Colonna Arms
items.description: A knight’s horse was vital in battle, protected with steel armor by 1400. This matching suit, weighing 114 pounds, featured etched decoration and likely belonged to the noble Völs-Colonna family.

items.title: Breastplate from Hussar's Cuirass
items.description: Likely worn by a Hungarian hussar, this breastplate features movable lames and once-blued steel, now russet. Its ornate gilding and gem fittings echo Near Eastern-inspired armor styles of the late Renaissance.

items.title: Crossbow & Cranequin of Elector Augustus I of Saxony
items.description: This ornate crossbow, complete with a cranequin, was used for hunting by Prince Elector Augustus I of the Holy Roman Empire, who embellished even utilitarian tools with lavish decoration.

items.title: Ram Mask (Bolo)
items.description: Bolo masks, worn by male dancers, appear at communal events like funerals and harvests. Blending human and animal traits, they reference the ram, a symbol of male aggression in sub-Saharan Africa.
items.summary: West Africa, Burkina Faso, possibly early 1900s

items.title: Prestige stool (Kuo fo)
items.description: Beaded wooden stools like this one were common royal objects in the Cameroon Grassfields. Used in private palace rituals, the leopard imagery signals kingship and the belief in a ruler’s transformative power.
items.summary: Central Africa, Cameroon, Bandjoun Kingdom, possibly 1800s

items.title: Prestige Chair
items.description: This Babanki chair from the Cameroon Grassfields features figures atop leopards—symbols of power—standing on a base with 24 heads. Such chairs marked kingship and were exchanged as royal gifts.

items.title: Krishna Lifting Mount Govardhan
items.description: This early Cambodian sculpture shows the Hindu god Krishna lifting a mountain to shield villagers and cattle from storms. It’s one of eight monumental figures found near Angkor Borei in the Mekong delta.
items.summary: Southern Cambodia, Takeo Province, Phnom Da, c.600

items.title: Naga-Enthroned Buddha
items.description: Jayavarman VII identified with the naga-enthroned Buddha, symbol of enlightened kingship. Later reinterpreted, it endures as an icon of compassion, wisdom, and prosperity in Cambodian tradition.
items.summary: Cambodia, Angkor, Angkor Wat Period, 12th century, 1100s

items.title: Portable icon of Shakyamuni Buddha in the Earth-touching gesture
items.description: The Buddha sits on a lotus pedestal flanked by serpents, symbolizing Khmer imperial glory. His gestures reflect enlightenment and prosperity, while the earth goddess below washes away Mara’s fleeing demon army.
